snippet: Having allowed the industry to consolidate so much already, regulators should work to preserve the choices customers still have.
abstract: Editorial supports Federal Communications Commission proposal to reserve some wireless frequencies for cellphone companies that do not control significant number of similar frequencies; notes policy will keep larger companies such as AT&T and Verizon from dominating airwaves; says proposal is reasonable one representing step toward preserving industry competition; warns, however, that regulators must do much more to promote consumer choice.
lead_paragraph: Having allowed the industry to consolidate so much already, regulators should work to preserve the choices customers still have.
